intro: Emplectanthus dalzellii, commonly known as the Dalzell's emplacanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
